content.text:
# Draft:Jessie Edwards Australian Basketball Player

Jessie Edwards is an Australian professional women's basketball player who played for the Perth Lynx and Adelaide Lightning in the WNBL, the Kalamunda Eastern Suns in the SBL and Cockburn Cougars in the NBL1 West, where she was a key player. She was also a recipient of the West Coast Waves, ( Now Perth Lynx ), Rookie of the Year award in the WNBL) and played for Western Australia at the U20 National Championships. Edwards has played internationally, with stints in Spain and Germany, and has also been involved in community programs for mental health and youth development in Western Australia.
Key Career Highlights
Status:
Signed 25-26 (Europe)
Position:
5/4
College:
Minnesota 2018
Professional:
Spain / Germ / Aust
Passport:
Australian, Great Britain
Height:
6'4 / 1.93
Update:
Jessie has signed in New Zealand with Southern Hoiho for the 2025 season!
Pro Highlights:
* ALL-Star 5 for the National Finals averaging 26 points, 13 boards and 2.6 blocks during (Cockburn ‘25)
* 12.9 points, 7.3 boards, 2 assists, 1.6 blocks, 59% FG (Cockburn ‘25)
* 11.9 points, 7.5 boards, 1.1 assists, 1.7 blocks & 55% FG (Cockburn ’24)
* 14 points, 9 boards,1.6 assists, 1.3 blocks & 57% FG (Cockburn ’23)
* All-NBL1 West 1st Team Selection! (Cockburn ’22)
* 17.63 points,11.4 boards, 2.05 assists, 1.68 blocks & .564 FG
* 19.6 points, 8 boards, 2.4 assists, 1.4 blocks & .594 FG (Cockburn ’21)
* 18 points, 10.6 boards, 2.55 assists & .53 FG (SBL West Coast Classic ’20)
* 17.4 points, 8.3 boards, 1.4 assists. 8 blocks & .523 FG  (Albury-Wodonga ’20)
* 17.5 points, 10.8 boards, 1.8 blocks & 47.8% FG  (TSV Towers ’19)
* West Coast Waves’ 2013-14 Rookie of the Year (WNBL)
* Western Australia 2014 U20 National Championships.
College Highlights:
* 6th All-Time in Blocks and 9th in Offensive Boards for Gophers
* 4th best all-time single season FG% with .598 (2017)
* Career stats of 5.93 points, 5.8 boards, 1.2 blocks & 57% FG
* Big Ten Player of Week Honor Roll (2017)
* Had 8 blocks vs Army (2017)
* Recipient of the Gophers Best Rebounder award (2017)
International:
Ibón Guridi Alcibar, Spain 2024-25; MBC Germany 2024 (fall); Australia 2020-2024, TSV Towers, Germany (2018-19)
* WNBL & NBL1: A prominent player for the Perth Lynx in the WNBL and the Cockburn Cougars in the NBL1 West.
* WNBL & Rookie of the Year: Honored as the West Coast Waves' Rookie of the Year in 2013-14.
* International Experience: Played professional basketball in various countries, including Spain and Germany.
* Community Involvement: Served as a Mental Health Officer and Program Developer with Strong Minds Strong Mines and the Purple Hands Foundation, focusing on mental health resources and youth leadership in Western Australia.
* College Career: Graduated from the University of Minnesota in 2018.
Further Information
* Nationality: Australian.
* Position: Center.
* Current Status: As of late 2024 and early 2025, she was still actively involved with the Cockburn Cougars and the ISB Iraugi.
